instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02987: What is 820-02987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 2020 No charge.
threads.message:
Hi‚Äô good fellows‚Ä¶
I am new and apology my rookie questions. Do you need further info ‚Äì let me know.
Macbook pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> without drops or fluid damage - smooth and clean. The history of the device; sent in because it couldn‚Äôt charge anymore. Charges if you take the charger out and in many times. Takes 19.2 volts and boots normally to .0600-0.700 amp (without battery), shows logo but crashes. circles (.100-.500amp )around until... Ends after 40 sek. It stops at 0.053 amp. Can‚Äôt find a short ‚Äì maybe a IC short? I want to hear if anyone knows of the boot row? it looks like the device is hitting something wrong through the boot process. Can anyone help me? I have a video of the bootprocess ‚Äì I will try to post it here (not possible:-).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 2020 No charge.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

You can't have a short on the board if get even image.

As always with T2 machines, start with DFU.
Try revive and go to restore, if no important data on SSD.
If need to recover data, check if you can access the SSD starting in Target Disk mode; before doing DFU restore.

Read below thread, for more information.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.message: Thank you 2informaticosüôè. I will try it tomorrow and let you know what happened‚ò∫Ô∏è. I do not need to recover anything so‚Ä¶ DFU It will beüòÖ

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP 2020 No charge.
threads.message: Hello 2informaticos. Follow-up on my problem ... After DFU and reinstalling/bridge ... it works 100% again. Unbelievable that a device can not boot due to a T2 chip :-). Many thanks for your advice and help!

threads.message:
